conclusion: Analyze the motion of the basketball before and after the collision, considering air resistance and gravity.
The basketball is dropped from a height H.
The initial potential energy is mgh where h = H.
The basketball experiences gravitational force mg and air resistance λmg.
Velocity just before collision found using energy conservation and work done by air resistance.
Work done by air resistance during the fall is λmgH.
Kinetic energy just before collision is mgH - λmgH.
Velocity v1 just before collision is √(2gH(1 - λ)).
Basketball rebounds to a height h.
Kinetic energy just after collision is mgh - λmgh.
Velocity v2 just after collision is √(2gh(1 - λ)).
Ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is √(h/H).
Final answer: The ratio of the post-collision velocity to the pre-collision velocity is √(h/H).
